title.rendered: Why It Is Critically Important to Design the Best Routes for Your Drivers

content.rendered:
To conquer the last mile, you’ll need the best routes possible.

In case you don’t know already, the “last mile” refers to the final step of the transportation process, where goods are delivered to the customer. This is the trickiest, most expensive link of the supply chain. There’s a lot that can go wrong here.

By adopting vehicle routing software, you can make the final mile much more affordable. Here’s how:

To Create Optimal Routes, You Need The Right Tools

Robots can’t write poetry. They don’t know what makes phrases beautiful; they don’t know what makes the truth the truth.

But these days, there are many things robots can do, from checking out groceries to filling out prescriptions, to fighting wars.

Indeed, machines do have some advantages over us. They’re more precise, more reliable.

Want To See For Yourself How Route4Me Can Boost Your Profits?

Whether you want to slash the time it takes you to plan routes for your drivers, increase the number of stops they can make, or keep your customers satisfied knowing that your drivers show up on time… Route4Me helps you achieve that!

Click Here To Test Drive It! (FREE TRIAL)

Don’t rely on humans for route planning purposes. Software will give you the best routes possible. Trying to create your routes manually is a recipe for disaster.

There’s just too much to keep track of. When you plan routes by yourself, you need to account for traffic, weather, construction, customer availability, and other factors. If you have dozens of customers and multiple drivers, that can take hours.

But when you have a multiple destination route planner, route planning only takes 30 seconds. All you need to do is plug in the addresses of your customers, customize the settings to fit your specific situation, and then you’re good to go.

Route planning software will save you time. It also helps your drivers show up on time more often, which makes it easier to keep your customers happy.

Turn Restrictions

Not all dynamic routing tools are equal.

Some have advanced features like turn restrictions, which will make your drivers even more efficient. Did you know that UPS saves hundreds of millions of dollars every year by simply avoiding left turns?

You could save a lot of money by eliminating left turns, too. Think about it: when your driver tries to turn left, they don’t have the right of way. They need to wait for traffic to clear before they can go. There’s no telling how long that will take!

You’ll be better off avoiding left turns whenever possible. Fleet mapping software with a turn restrictions feature allows you to do exactly that.

GPS Tracking

Of course, delivery scheduling software won’t do you any good if your drivers don’t actually follow the routes you give them.

That’s why you must make sure that the routing program you use has a GPS tracking feature.

With vehicle location tracking, you can see where your drivers are and how fast they’re going in real-time. Whenever you want, you can check in on a driver and confirm that they’re sticking to their route and staying on schedule.

title.rendered: How GPS Tracking Software Can Help You Control Cost Inflation

content.rendered:
Running a business is frustrating.

For every new client you sign, for every single dollar you bring in, it seems like there are a million little expenses that eat away at your profits.

You need to pay for wages, benefits, taxes, advertising, office space, electricity… you get the picture.

Some businesses are burdened with more expenses than others. For example, businesses like courier companies that send employees out to meet with customers must pay for gas, insurance, and vehicle maintenance on top of all the usual expenses.

But with the help of GPS tracking software, you can cut down on these costs significantly. Here’s how:

1. Save Money On Gas

When drivers get lost, they end up driving longer distances than necessary to complete their routes.

Driving isn’t free, of course. It requires gas, which costs money.

GPS tracking allows you to get your drivers back on track whenever they get lost. You’ll save a fortune on fuel this way.

2. Improve Productivity

What are your drivers really up to?

Do they drive defensively or tailgate their way down the highway? Do they stick to their routes and stay on schedule, or do they run personal errands while they’re on the clock?

You can’t see them, so how do you know?

GPS tracking is how. With vehicle location tracking, you can see where your drivers are in real-time, no matter how far away they are from the office. You’ll know exactly who to target with additional training (and discipline, if necessary).

The beauty of GPS tracking software is that you don’t even need to look at it for it to have an effect. When your drivers know they’re being watched, they’ll know they can’t mess around. You’ll get more bang for your buck from your payroll dollars.

3. Beat The Insurance Blues

In addition to showing you where your drivers are, GPS tracking software will show you how fast they’re going as well.

This will lower your insurance premiums.

Insurance is a gamble. An insurance provider only makes money when the premiums they collect add up to more than the claims they need to cover. The less likely you are to make a claim, the less an insurance provider will charge you for premiums.

GPS tracking software allows you to prove to providers that your drivers are being safe. That’ll knock a few dollars off your premiums, which frees up funds for other areas of your business.

Want To See For Yourself How Route4Me Can Boost Your Profits?

Whether you want to slash the time it takes you to plan routes for your drivers, increase the number of stops they can make, or keep your customers satisfied knowing that your drivers show up on time… Route4Me helps you achieve that!

Click Here To Test Drive It! (FREE TRIAL)

4. Make More Informed Business Decisions

You know what they say: knowledge is power.

A route planner with vehicle tracking capabilities collects information that you can use to test fuel efficiency techniques, evaluate your drivers, and just generally understand your business better.

5. Take Advantage Of Geofencing

GPS tracking software also makes geofencing possible.

Geofencing involves drawing custom borders over a real-world map. Then, you can set it up so that certain actions are triggered when your drivers cross through them.

For example, you can use geofences to automatically send your customers a text message when your driver is about to arrive. They’ll appreciate the notice!

Advanced features are what separate good vehicle routing software from great vehicle routing software.

In addition to GPS tracking software and geofencing, make sure the multiple destination route planner you invest in has eSignature capabilities.

With eSignature software, your customers are able to sign for deliveries directly on your driver’s smartphones.

Paper slips are easy to lose. This can lead to complications whenever a customer has a dispute. Adopting eSignature software solves this problem instantly – you’ll never lose a confirmation again.
